contentrichtext.text: '''Fines herbes''' is a [[combination of herbs]] that forms a mainstay of [[Mediterranean cuisine]]. The ingredients of fines herbes are fresh [[parsley]], [[chives]], [[tarragon]] and [[chervil]].<ref>[[Julia Child]], ''Mastering the Art of French Cooking'' vol. I p 18.</ref> These "fine herbs" are not the pungent and resinous herbs that appear in a ''[[bouquet garni]]'' â€“ which, unlike ''fines herbes'', release their flavour in long cooking. [[Marjoram]], [[Garden cress|cress]],<ref name=Katzer>{{cite web|url=http://gernot-katzers-spice-pages.com/engl/Alli_sch.html|title=Spice Pages: Chive (Allium schoenoprasum)|publisher=Gernot Katzer|accessdate=2012-12-02|last=Katzer|first=Gernot}}</ref> [[cicely]]<ref name=Katzer/> or [[lemon balm]]<ref name=Katzer/> may be added to ''fines herbes''. The marjoram may be dried. <gallery> Image:Krause_Petersilie_dichtwachsend.JPG|[[Parsley]] (Petroselinum crispum) Image:Allium_schoenoprasum(01).jpg|[[Chives]] (Allium schoenoprasum) Image:Estragon.jpg|[[Tarragon]] Image:Chervil.JPG|[[Chervil]] Image:Marjolaine.jpg|[[Marjoram]] File:Img 0717 garden cress.jpg|[[Garden cress]] File:Myrrhis odorata002.jpg|[[Cicely|Sweet cicely]] Image:Melissa_officinalis01.jpg|[[Lemon balm]] (Melissa officinalis) </gallery> == Notes == {{Reflist}} {{Herbs and spices}} {{spicemix-stub}} [[Category:Herb and spice mixtures]] [[Category:French cuisine]] [[Category:Occitan cuisine]]
